text:
Q: Using an Implicit Intersection in a Dynamic Array A:

Solved my own problem! In this instance you can just calculate the whole thing and filter it.

=FILTER((P:P-DAY(P:P)+1-IF(DAY(P:P)=1, DAY(P:P-1), 0)), A:A<>"", "")

Q: Not Found The requested URL was not found on the server. please check your spelling and try again A:

yy# Source - Not Found The requested URL was not found on the server. please check your spelling and try again

# Posted by pumpkin-sm, modified by community. See post 'Timeline' for change history

# Retrieved 2025-12-21, License - CC BY-SA 4.0

    ***\<title\>{{ site_title }}\</title\>***



    ***\<link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/main.css') }}"\>***

***\</head\>***

***\<body\>***

    ***\<header\>***

        ***\<h1\>{{ site_title }}\</h1\>***

    ***\</header\>***

    ***\<footer\>***

        ***\<p\>My name: {{ name }} My email: {{ my_email }}\</p\>***

    ***\</footer\>***

***\</body\>***

***\</html\>***

***and this is my index.html.j2***



***{% extends 'layouts/base.html.j2' %}***



***{% block navigation %}***

    ***\<nav\>***

        ***\<ul\>***

            ***\<li\>\<a href="/"class="current"\>Home\</a\>\</li\>***

            ***\<li\>\<a href="/questions"\>All Questions\</a\>\</li\>***

            ***\<li\>\<a href="/sources"\>All Sources\</a\>\</li\>***

        ***\</ul\>***

    ***\</nav\>***

***{% endblock %}***



***{% block content %}***

***\<section class="container"\>***

***\<h1\>Welcome to {{ site_title }}\</h1\>***



***\</section\>***



***\<section\>***

***\<p\>Select a question from the menu to view the answer, select all question to view all questions,answers and***

***sources, select sources to view all sources or search for a question below.\</p\>***





***\<form action="/" method="POST"\>***

    ***\<label for="query"\>Search:\</label\>***

    ***\<input type="text" name="query" id="query"\>***

    ***\<button type="submit"\>Search\</button\>***

***\</form\>***



***{% if query %}***

    ***\<h2\>Submitted***

Q: Django migrate error A:

The __unicode__ method is specific to Python 2. In Python 3, you should use the __str__ method. link

Correct code for python 3 compatibility:

from django.db import models
from django.template.defaultfilters import slugify

class Category(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=128, unique=True)
    views = models.IntegerField(default=0)
    likes = models.IntegerField(default=0)
    slug = models.SlugField(unique=True)

    def save(self, *args, **kwargs):
        # Ensure name exists before trying to slugify it
        if not self.slug:
            self.slug = slugify(self.name)
        super(Category, self).save(*args, **kwargs)

    # Use __str__ for Python 3
    def __str__(self):
        return self.name
